glsa.title: IMAP Proxy: Format string vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Format string vulnerabilities in IMAP Proxy may lead to the execution of arbitrary code when connected to malicious IMAP servers.

background.p: IMAP Proxy (also known as up-imapproxy) proxies IMAP transactions between an IMAP client and an IMAP server.

description.p: Steve Kemp discovered two format string errors in IMAP Proxy.

impact.p: A remote attacker could design a malicious IMAP server and entice someone to connect to it using IMAP Proxy, resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the victim user.

workaround.p: Only connect to trusted IMAP servers using IMAP Proxy.
